data.title: Automotive Industry Action Group
data.meta_description: AIAG is where auto industry members collaborate to develop common global standards for Quality, Supply Chain, and Corporate Responsibility issues
data.text:
2024 AIAG Mexico Automotive Forum

Registration is open for the 2024 AIAG Mexico Automotive Forum on September 12, 2024 in Mexico City, Mexico.REGISTER HERENow in its second year, the Mexico Automotive Forum is a unique collaboration between REDCAM, Cluster Automotriz Metropolitano, and AIAG. The ultimate success of the automotive industry hinges not only on maintaining, but also continuing to improve the quality of the vehicles and parts provided to consumers while keeping in mind sustainability and corporate responsibility. High expectations and new innovation continues to drive automakers and automotive suppliers to formulate and implement updated quality, sustainability and trade policies to prepare the automotive industry for the demands and technologies of the future. See information for Sponsorship and Exhibitor information below.

2024 Quality Summit

Do you need to get up to speed on the latest developments in automotive quality? Then you need to be at the 2024 AIAG Quality Summit!Focusing on new and evolving industry requirements, this year's event will include both OEM and supplier-specific perspectives on electrification and other cutting-edge technologies shaping the mobility landscape:IATF 16949 & Rules Sixth Updates and QA Session PanelJoint AIAG & VDA SPC Bluebook UpdateAutomating the Control Plan in Highly Automated ProcessesSafety Recall Processes for Over The Air Software Updates in Autonomous DrivingWiring Harness Management Assessment UpdateSoftware Assurance Approval Process UpdateJoint AIAG & VDA SPC Bluebook UpdateThe Role of IMDS in Corporate Responsibility ReportingQuality Cost 4.0 From Theory to DeploymentAnd more!During the conference and post conference on the first day, network with presenters and peers, representing companies like GM, Ford, Stellantis, Dana, Micron Technology, to name a few.There are also lunch table topics where you can sit and discuss what's important to you with experts from OEMs, Suppliers, and more. Whether you're new to automotive quality, an experienced user, or somewhere in between, this year's event is for you. Secure your spot today!VIEW AGENDAThe Exhibit Hall for this event is SOLD OUT but there are still Sponsorship Opportunities available. See link below for all the information.

2024 IMDS Product Compliance & Sustainability Conference

Registration is now available for our 2024 Hybrid IMDS, Product Compliance & Sustainability Conference, October 15-16! Held at Laurel Manor in Livonia, Michigan, this year's event will take place both in person and virtually, as we explore "The Role of IMDS in Corporate Responsibility Due Diligence." Join us to hear detailed presentations on Product Carbon Footprint (PCF) and its connection to data quality, electronic reporting in IMDS, the EU battery passport, and more, including: Life Cycle Assessments (LCAs). Mandatory Chemistry Manager reporting. IMDS version 14.3 and 14.4 updates (along with what's coming next in version 15.0). In-depth information on TSCA and PFAS. Updates from the IMDS Steering Committee on ELV, REACH, and other EU legislation, along with potential futures releases for IMDS. View the full agenda here: View Agenda While all attendees will benefit from live presentations, in person attendees will also have the opportunity to network with industry leaders and peers, discuss the latest innovations with event sponsors and exhibitors, engage in "Table Talk" on trending topics during lunch, and of course participate in our end-of-event networking reception. Those joining us in person can also choose from one of three half day training sessions on October 17: PCF training; IMDS Tips and Tricks for Basic and Advanced Users; and EU Battery Passport/Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive and Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism Requirements. Click Here To Register for this Optional Training. Whether you're new to IMDS, an experienced user, or somewhere in between, this year's event is for you. Secure your spot today! Download our event flyer to share: Event Flyer

2024 IMDS Conference Day 3 Trainings

Registration is now open for our 2024 Hybrid IMDS, Product Compliance & Sustainability Conference, Day 3 Optional Training Sessions. These sessions will take place at Laurel Manor in Livonia, Michigan. Attendees can select one of the three in person only training options on October 17, scheduled from 9 AM to 12 PM: Developing and Delivering PCFs Across the Automotive Supply Chain: Understand and interpret Product Carbon Footprints (PCFs), gathering and analyzing PCF data, and developing actionable reduction strategies using the Catena-X standards. Hear testimonials from productive use. IMDS Data Wizardry: Unlock Your Full Potential (for both basic and advanced users): Learn how to improve Data Quality in IMDS. Learn how to complete specific functions within IMDS such as Chemistry Manager, Recyclate, Where Used Analysis, PCF Fields, 8.X and more. EU Battery Passport/Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) & Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) Requirements and More: Learn more about the European Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) and the Carbon Boarder Adjustment Mechanism Regulation (CBAM), and likely impacts upon the global automotive supply chain. Whether you're new to IMDS, an experienced user, or somewhere in between, these training will help! Secure your spot today! If you need to register for the IMDS Product Compliance & Sustainability Conference Click Here

2024 North American Customs and Trade Town Hall

Registration is open for the North American Customs and Trade Town Hall!View Event Agenda TRADE. KNOWLEDGE. The Automotive Action Industry Group (AIAG) promises you an in-depth exploration of pressing topics in the North American Customs & Trade compliance world. The economies of the United States, Canada, and Mexico are highly integrated and underpinned by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA, T-MEC and CUSMA). Together, Canada, the United States, and Mexico comprise almost a third of global GDP. As governments and companies alike increasingly prioritize economic resilience and security in response to larger geopolitical forces, there are significant opportunities for enhancing cross-continent trade and investment to the mutual benefit of all three countries. JOIN US in person for this year's town hall featuring top rated government and industry speakers covering key topics, including: North American Relations - US, Mexico and Canada CTPAT and AEO Trade Compliance Drawback - Duty Recovery & Duty Mitigation Export ModernizationForced Labor Global Business Identifier (GBI) and more! Strengthen your portfolio with excellent networking opportunities, and chat and meet with customs industry brokers! 6 NCBFAA CREDITS are awarded upon completion of the event, subject to attendance verification. Don't miss out on our early bird registration rate! Sponsorships and exhibit booths are available! See link to form below.
